Info.Description: Applies a blur effect to the image that preserves edges. This is achieved by blurring pixels based on both their spatial proximity and their color similarity to a central pixel. It's useful for reducing noise or texture in an image while maintaining sharp edges.

Properties.Name: Sigma
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the spatial intensity of the blur. A higher sigma value will increase the radius of the blur, making the effect more pronounced. However, unlike a standard blur, the bilateral blur will preserve edges regardless of the sigma value.

Properties.Name: BSigma
Properties.Summary: Controls the color intensity threshold for the blur. Pixels with a color difference greater than this value from the central pixel will not be blurred. This helps to preserve edges and details in the image.

Properties.Name: Kernel Size
Properties.Summary: Sets the size of the region around each pixel that the filter considers when applying the blur. A larger kernel size will result in a smoother image but might also increase processing time.
